SciViews v1.4.0

Data Processing and Visualization with the SciViews::R Dialect

Philippe Grosjean

2022-09-15

Source: vignettes/SciViews.Rmd
SciViews.Rmd

The SciViews::R dialect is base R + tidyverse + a series of SciViews packages like data.io, svFlow, or chart that makes a coherent and straightforward environment for data processing and visualization. In order to load all required packages, just use:

SciViews::R()
#> Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'svBase':
#>   method           from      
#>   print.data.frame base      
#>   print.data.table data.table
#> ── Attaching packages ───────────────────────────────────── SciViews::R 1.4.0 ──
#> ✔ SciViews   1.4.0        ✔ dtplyr     1.2.2   
#> ✔ chart      1.4.0        ✔ dplyr      1.0.10  
#> ✔ data.io    1.4.1        ✔ tidyr      1.2.1   
#> ✔ svFlow     1.2.1        ✔ tibble     3.1.8   
#> ✔ svBase     1.2.1        ✔ ggplot2    3.3.6   
#> ✔ svMisc     1.3.0        ✔ data.table 1.14.2  
#> ✔ fs         1.5.2        ✔ lattice    0.20.45 
#> ✔ collapse   1.8.8        ✔ MASS       7.3.58.1
#> ✔ forcats    0.5.2        ✔ rlang      1.0.5   
#> ✔ broom      1.0.1
#> ── Conflicts ─────────────────────────────────────────── SciViews_conflicts() ──
#> ✖ data.table:::=() masks rlang:::=()
#> ✖ svFlow::!!()     masks rlang::!!()
#> ✖ svMisc::?()      masks utils::?()
#> ✖ dplyr::between() masks data.table::between()
#> ✖ collapse::D()    masks stats::D()
#> ✖ dplyr::filter()  masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::first()   masks data.table::first()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()     masks stats::lag()
#> ✖ dplyr::last()    masks data.table::last()
#> ✖ dplyr::select()  masks MASS::select()
#> ✖ data.io::write() masks base::write()
#> ── Default data frame object (dtx) ─────────────────────────────── data.table ──
